onyomiExamples.meaning: bowing one's head (in respect or worship), worship, respectfully yours
Dear (so and so), Dear Sir, Dear Madam, To Whom It May Concern
bowing twice, worshipping again, Yours sincerely, Yours truly, Sincerely yours

kunyomiExamples.meaning: to assume the posture of praying, to press the palms and fingers of both hands together, to do reverence (e.g. before a statue of the Buddha), to pay one's respects, to beg, to make a supplication, to see (something or someone of high status)
